name: cross section tubes
desc: Produce open or closed tubes of user defined cross-section and constant or data dependent radius using 3D lines or polylines as input for the center line and a single 2D polyline as the cross-section of the tubes.

properties.name: Switch Property View
properties.desc: Edit the renderable (red) port properties for the module.

properties.name: Radius By
properties.desc: The Radius By choice allows the user to choose constant or data dependent radius scaling.

properties.name: Constant Data For Radius
properties.desc: If Radius By is set to Constant, the Constant Data For Radius can be set using this control.

properties.name: Cell Data For Radius
properties.desc: The Cell Data for Radius allows you to choose the cell data component for scaling.

properties.name: Nodal Data For Radius
properties.desc: The Nodal Data for Radius allows you to choose the nodal data component for scaling.

properties.name: Scale Factor
properties.desc: The Scale Factor value is multiplied by the nodal data to determine the radius.

properties.name: Minimum Radius
properties.desc: The Minimum Radius control sets the minimum tube radius.

properties.name: Tolerance
properties.desc: The Tolerance parameter determines the maximum distance between nodes of adjacent line segments before those line's nodes should be merged to form a polyline. This also applies to closed polyline contours. Closed polylines will have their starting and ending nodes merged to form closed (torroidal) annuli.

properties.name: Close Tubes
properties.desc: The Close Tubes toggle causes the tubes to have solid ends. However the tubes are not solid objects (they are hollow).

properties.name: Connect Tubes
properties.desc: If the Connect Tubes toggle is on, tubes formed by connecting line segments will connect together.

properties.name: Percentile
properties.desc: The Percentile value allows you to control the automatic scaling of tubes based on the nth percentile value (versus the maximum 100th%).  This addresses datasets where there are only a few nodes with extremely high values.

properties.name: Phase
properties.desc: The Phase value allows you to control the apparent rotation of tubes. This is specified in degrees of rotation.

properties.name: Phase Determination
properties.desc: The Phase Determination is used to set how the tubes are aligned. Perpendicular Extrusion is typically preferred if tubes approach vertical. Force Z Up works better for horizontal tubes.

properties.name: Map Nodal Data
properties.desc: The Map Nodal Data options allow the user to select those nodal data components that are used for coloring or subsequent subsetting operations.

properties.name: Map Cell Data
properties.desc: The Map Cell Data options allow the user to select those cell data components that are used for coloring or subsequent subsetting operations.

properties.name: Include Center Data
properties.desc: The Include Center Data toggle will tell the module to include the center point of each tube end point as a cell data component.  This allows the user to probe onto the tube and return its center instead of the position on the outside of the tube.
